intro: Strobilanthes willisii, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame of the woods," is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or pale pink. Strobilanthes willisii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant, eye-catching appearance.
